name: Lobstick Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night and that was enough.
reviews.title: Over priced & dingy

reviews.text: Our room was in the basement and was dark, unwelcoming and smelled musty.
reviews.title: Terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Compared to other canadian accomodation, it was overpriced, and very disappointing.
reviews.title: O.K. but not great
Good hospitality.
reviews.text: We were disappointed with this hotel.

reviews.title: An "Alright" Place If Nowhere Else To Stay!!
reviews.text: Noise from the front desk, people in the lobby and plumbing entered our rooms through 1-inch gaps at the bottom of the doors all night. Cigarette smoke polluting non-smoking rooms is also a problem. No air-conditioning. Not particularly clean. Serious updating is needed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days as part of a 15 day trip to canada. We were very disappointed, the room we were allocated was in the basement, it was dark, tatty and depressing. It also had a very strange smell which was very unpleasant.
reviews.title: disappointing place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If the hotel had not been pre-booked as part of our holiday we would not have stayed there. The breakfasts were only average and we ate elsewhere after the first day. It wasn't a place we enjoyed staying and wouldn't recommend it.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: Having read the reports on tripadvisor we were very worried about this hotel and had tried to change our accomodation before leaving the UK. However we were told by our travel agent that they had not received any negative reports from previous customers this year and so we decided to try it for the four nights that we had originally booked.
reviews.title: Be Careful of this hotel

likes.liked: — it is alot further then 5 blocks from the train station-more like 2-3 miles

reviews.text: It is a little way out of town amongst a number of other hotels in the area however has we had a hire car it presented no problem to us, and there was sufficient parking spaces at the hotel. On arrival we were greeted by the reception staff in an organised way which was maybe lacking a little in the depth of the welcome and were then left to organise our cases and to find our room.
reviews.title: This is one to avoid
never again
reviews.text: We had booked a superior room which turned out to be on the third floor and it contained two very large beds with the resulting floor space which created a nice atmosphere. However it was also close to the upstairs dining room which caused us some initial concern regarding possible noise disturbance which did not prove to founded during our stay.

Stayed three nights in a kitchenette suite on the first floor. Nicely appointed, with separate bedroom, dining/living/eating/kitchen area and bathroom. The only windows in the suite were in the bedroom, so natural light was hard to come by in the living area -- we used the table/floor lamps rather than the harsh fluorescent ceiling fixture. The bathroom was really nice, with above-average toiletries and fixtures that appeared brand-new, including a very spacious-feeling shower/tub and a tilting mirror. Kitchen was well-appointed with glasses, dishes, cutlery and cooking pots, even a colander and a broiler pan. TVs in both the bedroom and the living room -- a nice touch. The (older) refrigerator was noisy, ending its cycle with a loud bang each time -- we reported this issue when we left.
reviews.title: A nice alternative to pricier places

likes.liked: — Secluded, quiet, clean and nicely appointed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Houskeeping was very efficient and kept the room spotless. As soon as we put out the "please make up room" sign, it was cleaned for us.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The walls and ceiling were a little thin -- we could hear conversations from next door and in the hall quite clearly. We were pleasantly undisturbed at night, however, from both internal and external noise -- we'd worried that we would be disturbed by the trains that run through Jasper all hours of the day and night, but this was not the case. Geikie Street is a block or two off Connaught, the main drag, so we weren't bothered by traffic noise either.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: Staff were pleasant and lobby was attractive, and the rate we paid was less for three nights than we would have paid for a single night at Jasper Park Lodge. We'd stay there again.
reviews.title: Just a place to stay

likes.disliked: — the room - which is the most important

reviews.title: Nicely surprised
reviews.text: We booked the Lobstick Lodge through a UK travel agent and were a little bit concerned after reading various reviews. However we were pleasantly surprised and had a very enjoyable three nights. Our 2nd floor room (UK 1st floor) was clean and looked fairly newly decorated. Although it would be difficult not to have good views in Jasper, our room looked out over the side car park with good mountain views. The bar and restaurant were OK, nothing special but clean and friendly. It was a 5-10 minute walk to the sights of Jasper and we had no noise problems. Free internet access via the computer in the lobby helped us check on email. Overall, for us it was a very positive experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were booked into the Lobstick during a tour, as our original hotel, the Fairmont, was full. Our room was in the basement and it was dingy, dark and smelly. We asked for an alternative room but none were available, so we were told!
reviews.title: Hated the Lobstick!

reviews.text: We did not eat at the Lobstick and took every oportunity to stay out of this dingy hole.
reviews.title: A good stay without issues
Nice hotel and friendly
reviews.text: What made matters worse, was that the hotel we had just left was the Chateau Lake Louise, which was fantastic, so the Lobstick was a real let-down after that. It seems that jasper is devoid of decent hotels, which is a pity, as the rest of Canada seems to have good lodging. Stay clear of the Lobstick!
We stayed for two nights (5th & 6th May 2007) and were a little apprehensive before departure having read the previous reviews - particularly those about the rooms on the ground floor.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Fortunately, we were given 2 rooms on 3rd floor which were faultless. Both rooms had a pair of large sized beds, were clean and spacious with all the expected amenities (en-suite bathroom, desk, sink, large TV etc). Staff were friendly and helpful and we ate in the hotel restaurant on the ground floor several times without any issues whatsoever.
reviews.title: Unrefined and missed potential

likes.liked: — Very good facilities, good resturant, nice hot tubs.
likes.disliked: — No air conditioning, service rooms mixed with guest rooms.

description: Recently renovated and located within the town of Jasper, Lobstick Lodge is near all the area's major attractions. With 139 spacious guestrooms and rooms with kitchenettes, this Jasper resort offers an excellent family restaurant, Season's Cafe, meeting and catering facilities, an indoor pool and sauna, 3 outdoor Jacuzzis, 1 indoor Jacuzzi and a fitness center. Lobstick Lodge is also a great skiing destination with friendly, knowledgeable staff.
